metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1584 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The Public Key Pinning (PKP) implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 33.0 skips pinning checks upon an unspecified issuer-verification error, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass an intended pinning configuration and spoof a web site via a crafted certificate that leads to presentation of the Untrusted Connection dialog to the user.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
